title: Font used at Tampa airport
content:
Friend takes me for a font guru and asked if I knew which font was used in the Tampa airport. Which I didn't. Do you?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TPA%202011-1_5715.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537im_/http:/typophile.com/files/TPA%202011-2_5468.jpg)
author: elzadra

comments.content: Don't know this one, could even be custom. Some similars: [Adrianna](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/chank/adrianna), [Presicav](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typodermic/presicav)

[This blog (dated 2008)](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/blog.iso50.com/2946/tampa-airport/) states that the font is Trade Gothic LT Std Bold Extended.

In their Design Criteria manual, related items are simply marked 'reserved', meaning that no policy has been established, I think.
I didn't verify that font id ...
That /a is clearly a Venus Extended (Bauer 1900). So this one must be some Venus-Inspired revival or interpretation.

That's right, part of the /a which is probably why you're still discussing on this case, that's very close (if not matching) [Trade Gothic Extended Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/trade-gothic/bold-extended-63882) and especially when you look at this [sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/blog.iso50.com/wp-content/uploads/2008/11/dsc-1895-copy-tm1.jpg) pointed out by Herb. Some more to think about: [Akzidenz Grotesk Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/akzidenz-grotesk-bq), [Standard Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/standard) (probably the closest I've found), [Reservation Wide](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typetrust/reservation-wide), [Embarcadero](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mvbfonts/embarcadero), [Sweet Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/sweet/sans), [CG Gothic Extended](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.linotype.com/fr/149780/CGGothicExtraLightExtended-product.html) (only Extra Light unfortunately), [Splendid Grotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/typophile.com/node/38174), [Vonness](http://web.archive.org/web/20130824164537/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Vonness)
